channel.title: Programmability on Prasenjit Manna
channel.description: Recent content in Programmability on Prasenjit Manna

item.title: What is APIs?
item.description: What is APIs? Application Programming Interfaces (APIs) are module: they take inputs and give you predictable outputs. At its core, an API is a bunch of code that takes an input and gives you an output Sometimes, companies will make parts of their APIs publicly available, like github, Twitter or Google Maps In modern era, your favourite applications are collection of APIs. In WWW, the programmatic service is provided by the APIs.

item.title: Network Programmability, which is preferred? SNMP or CLI or Yang
item.description: Network Programmability, which is preferred? SNMP or CLI or Yang Network programmability is directly linked to Software Defined Network (SDN). So, it is driven by real benefits like time and cost savings, reduction of human error, customization and innovation. The network programmability is now understood as a set of tools and best practices to deploy, manage and troubleshoot network device, but it’s way beyond that. Network programmability is not new. From the screen scrapping, to bash and expect scripts.
